CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: AFM , TEM , and PL quenching measurements revealed that the high J sc s are a result of the appropriate morphology and efficient charge separation.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| AFM |
| TEM |
| PL |

Explanation:

AFM, TEM, and PL are the material names mentioned in the paragraph. AFM stands for Atomic Force Microscopy, TEM stands for Transmission Electron Microscopy, and PL stands for Photoluminescence. These are all techniques used in materials science to analyze and characterize materials.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| high J sc s |

Explanation:

After re-evaluating the paragraph, I realized that "high J sc s" is the only possible material name mentioned in the paragraph. Although it is not a standard material name, it is mentioned in the context of the paragraph as a material property that is being measured and analyzed using AFM, TEM, and PL techniques. Therefore, I have included it as a material name in the table.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: AFM , TEM , and PL quenching measurements revealed that the high J sc s are a result of the appropriate morphology and efficient charge separation.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| the high J |
| appropriate morphology |
| efficient charge separation |

Note: I'm assuming "J scs" is a typo and it should be "Jc's" which refers to critical current density. Also, "AFM", "TEM", and "PL" are measurement techniques and not property values, so I didn't include them in the table.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| high Jc's |

Note: After re-evaluating the paragraph, I found that the only clear "Value of material property" is "high Jc's" which refers to high critical current density. Other entities such as "appropriate morphology" and "efficient charge separation" are descriptive phrases that do not explicitly refer to a specific material property value.
